DzOpenGLRenderProgress Class Reference
[Interface Components]

Class that provides progress and a cancel button during OpenGL renders. More...

Detailed Description

Class that provides progress and a cancel button during OpenGL renders.

This class is used to safely provide the ability to cancel OpenGL renders, without the danger of corrupting the final image. This is mainly a framework-only class and probably will not be encountered outside the core.

Member Function Documentation

bool DzOpenGLRenderProgress::isCancelled (  )  const
Returns:
true if the user has cancelled the render.
void DzOpenGLRenderProgress::startRender (  ) 

Called by the framework to start the render. After this is called, this class traps all key and mouse events from the application, to keep the user from interacting with the interface. This must be matched by a call to stopRender() or the user will be unable to interact with the application indefinitely.

void DzOpenGLRenderProgress::statusLine ( const QString &  status,
bool  log = false 
)

Prints the given status message to the status bar

void DzOpenGLRenderProgress::stopRender (  ) 

Called by the framework when the render has been completed. This call releases the event filter that traps key and mouse events - allowing the user to interact with the application again.
